article_text:
Verizon CEO Lowell McAdam is receiving hosannas for his takedown Wednesday of Bernie Sanders, in which he rapped the presidential candidate’s views on corporate America as “uninformed,” “contemptible,” and “wrong”—among other things. He’d be worthy of even more praise had he also applied those words to the “Not I” business community that helped create this moment.

Mr. McAdam is right that Mr. Sanders is wrong. American businesses aren’t immoral. They create jobs, prosperity, investment and tax revenue. They are the...

twitter.description: Potomac Watch columnist Kimberley A. Strassel writes that after nonstop attacks on business by liberals, especially Bernie Sanders, some companies and CEOs are finally standing up for themselves.
twitter.title: Bernie’s Spinal Surgery on CEOs
